content:
Here's the final schema and documentation for your MongoDB database tailored to your requirements:

**Collections:**

1. `websites`
2. `classic_websites`
3. `game_engines`
4. `platforms`
5. `web_crawls`
6. `crawl_errors`
7. `crawl_queue`

**Fields and relationships:**

1. `websites` collection:
	* \_id (ObjectId)
	* url (string)
	* title (string)
	* description (string)
	* keywords (array of strings)
	* graphics (object)
		+ poly\_count (integer)
		+ texture\_size (string, e.g., "1024x1024")
	* world (object)
		+ size (string, e.g., "1000x1000")
		+ environment (string, e.g., "indoor", "outdoor")
	* immersion\_type (string, e.g., "VR", "AR", or "both")
	* game\_engine\_id (ObjectId, reference to `game_engines._id`)
	* platform\_id (ObjectId, reference to `platforms._id`)
	* related\_websites (array of ObjectId, references to `websites._id`)
	* classic\_referrer\_websites (array of ObjectId, references to `classic_websites._id`)
	* crawl\_id (ObjectId, reference to `web_crawls._id`)
2. `classic_websites` collection:
	* \_id (ObjectId)
	* url (string)
	* title (string)
	* description (string)
	* keywords (array of strings)
	* crawl\_id (ObjectId, reference to `web\_crawls.\_id
